    Order

    Caryophyllales

      Family (40)

      Caryophyllaceae

        Genus (103)

        Dianthus
          Prev genus | Next genus

          Display options

          Ver. 19.1
          March 1st, 2024

          388.0000 Family Caryophyllaceae Juss.; Gen. Pl.: 299 (1789), nom. cons.
          102 genera, ca. 3250 spp. Higher systematics: Xue et al. (2023)
          Species listed in database: 3330; hybrids: 58
          = Alsinaceae Bartl.; Bartl. & H. L. Wendland, Beitr. Bot. 2: 159 (1825), nom. cons.
          = Cerastiaceae Vest; Anleit. Stud. Bot.: 271, 292 (1818)
          = Corrigiolaceae Dumort.; Anal. Fam. Pl.: 44, 49 (1829)
          = Dianthaceae Vest; Anleit. Stud. Bot.: 271, 293 (1818)
          = Herniariaceae Martinov; Tekhno-Bot. Slovar: 307 (1820)
          = Illecebraceae R.Br.; Prodr. Fl. Nov. Holland: 413 (1810), nom. cons.
          = Lychnidaceae Döll; Rhein. Fl.: 638 (1843)
          = Minuartiaceae Mart.; Consp. Regn. Veg.: 49 (1835)
          = Ortegaceae Martinov; Tekhno-Bot. Slovar: 443 (1820)
          = Paronychiaceae Juss.; Mém. Mus. Hist. Nat. 2: 386 (1815)
          = Polycarpaeaceae Mart.; Consp. Regn. Veg.: 49 (1835)
          = Sabulinaceae Döll; Rhein. Fl.: 623 (1843)
          = Saginaceae Bercht. & J.Presl; Prir. Rostlin: 239 (1820)
          = Scleranthaceae J.Presl & C.Presl; Delic. Prag.: 66 (1822)
          = Silenaceae Bartl.; Bartl. & H. L. Wendland, Beitr. Bot. 2: 160 (1825)
          = Spergulaceae Bartl.; Bartl. & H. L. Wendland, Beitr. Bot. 2: 158 (1825)
          = Stellariaceae Bercht. & J.Presl; Prir. Rostlin: 239 (1820)
          = Telephiaceae Martinov; Tekhno-Bot. Slovar: 633 (1829)
          388.0832 Genus Dianthus L.; Sp. Pl. 409 (1753)
          Distribution: Eurasia (mostly Southern Europe: over 150), Africa, Russia (ca. 100, from European part to Far East). There are significant species delimitation problems in S- and SE-Europe based on many local, weakly separated species and rampant hybridization, leading also to oversplitting in many cases.
          Species listed in database: 358; hybrids: 19
          = Caryophyllus Mill.; Gard. Dict. Abridg. Ed. 4 (1754)
          = Caryophyllus Tourn. ex Moench; Methodus: 58 (1794)
          = Cylichnanthus Dulac; Fl. Hautes-Pyr. 260 (1867)
          = Diosanthos St.-Lag.; Ann. Soc. Bot. Lyon 7: 87 (1880)
          = Pleonanthus Ehrh.; Beitr. 4: 148 (1789)
          = Plumaria Opiz; Seznam: 75 (1852), nom. nud.
          = Tunica Ludw.; Inst. Reg. Veg., ed. 2: 129 (1757), nom. superfl.
          = Velezia L.; Sp. Pl.: 332 (1753)

          Prev genus

          A complete, synonymic checklist of the Higher Plants of the World

          Version 19.1 (March 1st, 2024)

          Covering 354,262 accepted species,
          8,619 hybrids, 47,813 accepted infraspecific taxa and 995,578 synonyms,
          in total 1,406,272* names

          [*about 25,000 dubious, "unplaced" names and about 4,000 invalid names (Art. 24.3) like "typicus" are deliberately omitted]

          With complete, detailed distribution data (countries and regions) and literature references

          Arranged in linear phylogenetic sequence reflecting true relationships

          Fully searchable and continously updated

          With 38,290 pictures of 15,532 species

          Assembled through 40 years independently from other databases

          In cooperation with Catalogue of Life

          Contact

          Dr. Michael Hassler

          Weiherbergstr. 77
          D-76646 Bruchsal
          Germany

          How to Cite:

          Hassler, Michael (1994 - 2024): World Plants. Synonymic Checklist and Distribution of the World Flora. Version 19.1; last update March 1st, 2024. - www.worldplants.de. Last accessed dd/mm/yyyy.
